item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.wishlistcomment: Originally a kickstarter, this looks like a dice game with some strong worker placement mechanics. Seems like it is in a similar vein to Kingsburg. I rarely see it new below the $60 MSRP, but would really like to get it if it goes below ~$45.

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment: Played with 4. Seems like the game really opens up with 5, so I'm mostly reserving judgment until I try it that way. Update: Have played now with 6-8 people. Better, but still not the best thing in the world.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.wishlistcomment: Bean-farming card game. A little older, so it's hard to tell if it really is good, or if it's just that there were fewer games back then so people treat it like a classic.

item.name: Bruges
item.wishlistcomment: Another Euro. Don't remember what this one was about, but we saw a review and it looked fun enough to add to the wish list. Probably another one that Kelly would like more than me.

item.name: Codenames
item.wishlistcomment: Big hit at GenCon 2015, seems like it would be a great one for our group as well. A "Spymaster" gives clues to get their team to pick the correct codenames, while trying to prevent them from guessing the other team's, or the Assassin.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.wishlistcomment: Zombie Apocalypse super thematic co-op with a betrayer mechanic.

item.name: Diamonds
item.wishlistcomment: Like Hearts, but with Diamonds. Has a mechanic where you are collecting gems, so it seems to be a little deeper.

item.name: The Dwarf King
item.wishlistcomment: A trick-taking game, where one of the suits is replaced by a bunch of cards with special abilities.

item.name: Eldritch Horror
item.wishlistcomment: Updated, tightened up version of Arkham Horror. Cthulu mythos co-op, on the longer side (few hours).

item.name: For Sale
item.wishlistcomment: Out of Print.

item.name: Forbidden Desert: Storm Tracker Gear Card
Istanbul
item.wishlistcomment: A worker-placement Euro where you move your pieces around the board to try and get gems. Has some 5-tribes-ish movement. Seems fun. Kelly wants this one more than I do.

item.name: Jamaica
item.wishlistcomment: Out of print. Should be returning shortly.

item.name: Kingsburg: To Forge a Realm
item.wishlistcomment: Apparently a must-have expansion to a fun game. Adds a grab-bag of new mechanics and options.

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: Dark City
item.wishlistcomment: The first big-box expansion for Legendary. Adds a TON of new heroes and villains, and a bunch of new mechanics. Looks like a must-have, even if I only know who about half of the heroes are.

item.name: Legendary: Guardians of the Galaxy
item.wishlistcomment: Adds the guardians, and a couple of new villains. Also adds a "shard" mechanic and artifact cards.

item.name: Legendary: Secret Wars â€“ Volume 1
item.wishlistcomment: Second big-box expansion for Marvel Legendary. Looks fun, but haven't heard any reviews yet, so I want to hold out for some to see if it's worth picking up.

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Medieval Academy
item.wishlistcomment: Recently-released in the US. This looks like a light game where you are selecting actions and moving up and down on several different point tracks. At the end of each of five rounds, all of the tracks score differently, so you have to decide where to spend your actions this round.

item.name: Murano
item.wishlistcomment: Another middle-weight Euro, this time about building stores and selling goods in Italy. Looked OK, but a little expensive for me.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey
item.wishlistcomment: This was reviewed as a better version of Clue, a whodunnit deduction game that would be a good gateway, and still looks pretty fun.

item.name: New Salem
item.wishlistcomment: Hidden Roles + Drafting, where it is villagers vs. witches. Seems like it would go over well with our group. Think Resistance plus Sushi Go.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.wishlistcomment: I think I played this with Phil once. It was a fun, quick card game, and looks easy to teach, in a similar vein as For Sale.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.wishlistcomment: Definitely a heavier Euro, and currently one of the top rated games on BGG. Looks good for when we're in the mood for a headier game.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Scoville
item.wishlistcomment: Game about planting and harvesting peppers. Everyone is working with a common field, so you are moving your character to pick peppers, and combining peppers to plant new ones and complete and sell chili recipes. Looks like an interesting theme on an interactive euro.

item.name: Seasons
item.wishlistcomment: I remember we watched a review and thought it looked fun, and the components are pretty, but I can't for the life of me remember the mechanics. Seems to be in the middle-weight Euro category that is always popular with Kelly and myself.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.wishlistcomment: Probably the original co-op with betrayer game. I would love to play it, but would rather own one of the games that has eclipsed it, like Dead of Winter.

item.name: Sheriff of Nottingham
item.wishlistcomment: Game where you are trying to smuggle goods past a sheriff to get points. Each turn the role of the sheriff shifts to the next person. Looks like a great bluffing game.

item.name: Sleuth
item.wishlistcomment: An older deduction game. Looks fun, but is out of print and hard to find.

item.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault
item.wishlistcomment: Star Wars D&D.

item.name: Terror in Meeple City
item.wishlistcomment: A dexterity game where you flick meeples around and try to destroy a city. Kelly thought it looked fun.

item.name: Through the Ages: A New Story of Civilization
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 5 â€“ United Kingdom & Pennsylvania
Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.wishlistcomment: A relatively inexpensive expansion that adds quite a bit to one of Kelly's favorite games. Probably worth getting at some point.

item.name: XCOM: The Board Game
item.wishlistcomment: An asymmetric co-op game, where each player controls a part of the agency that is dealing with an alien invasion. Has an iPad app to act as narrator and timer. Looks like a fun gimmick.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.wishlistcomment: This looked like a really fun game about running a zoo, and keeping it filled with animals. Appears to be in the light- to medium-weight euro that Kelly and I both like. Plus, the theme looks fun.
